alert.note: Alert for Alachua; Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 9:50AM EDT until March 31 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Santa Fe River near High Springs affecting Alachua and Columbia Counties. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Fe River near High Springs. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, High water will begin to impact docks and boat ramps in the area. At 34.2 feet, Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission begins enforcement of a no wake zone on the Santa Fe River from the River Rise in O`Leno State Park downstream to the center line of the US 27 Bridge. At 35.0 feet, Wooded areas along the river begin to flood. The boat ramp south of US-441 in Alachua County is inaccessible above this level. At 37.0 feet, Water begins to approach two residences along the river at the end of Southeast Resort Circle in Columbia County. The boat ramp near the US-27 bridge in Columbia County begins to flood at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 35.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 35.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 34.0 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
